page.title: 01BLAKENEY HARBOUR
page.content: The outer part of a mainly pleasure boat harbour north of the village of Stiffkey. Ferry boats only able to operate at high tide - trips to Norfolk Naturalist Trust land leased from National Trust and the most important bird sanctuary in North Norfolk known as Blakeney Point. Area includes land between LWMOT and high water mark of ordinary tides - mud and sand. Famous for cockles still known as Stewky (Stiffkey) blues. Some fishing but harbour best known for sheltered safe sailing. An area of outstanding natural beauty part of the heritage coastline.
